page.title: 01NORTH EAST LIVERPOOL
page.content: THE AREA AS A WHOLE CAN BE DIVIDED INTO{THREE SECTIONS.}THE AREA TO THE SOUTH OF THE LIVERPOOL RING ROAD(THE A5058)AND TO THE NORTH OF THE A580(WALTON HALL AVENUE AND EAST LANCASHIRE ROAD)IS,GENERALLY SPEAKING,THE AREA WITH THE OLDEST HOUSING.MANY OF THESE HOUSES WERE BUILT ABOUT ONE HUNDRED YEARS AGO AND NOW FORM THE{ANFIELD AND WALTON AREAS OF THE CITY.THE SOUTH EAST CORNER IS THE OLDEST HISTORICAL AREA,{WEST DERBY BEING MENTIONED IN {THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK.}THE REST OF THE REGION IS KNOWN AS THE{NORRIS {GREEN}AREA OF THE CITY.MOST OF THIS AREA COMPRISES OF A HUGE COUNCIL HOUSE ESTATE,BEING BUILT IN THE 1920'S AND 30'S.THE ONLY INDUSTRY IN THE REGION IS IN A SMALL INDUSTRIAL ESTATE IN WALTON.{THE REGION IS SUFFERING MAJOR {UNEMPLOYMENT PROBLEMS.
